required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Natural Cycle or Stimulated Cycle Versus Hormone Replaced Cycle for Pre-eclampsia Rate
clinical_study.official_title: The Live Birth Rate in Natural Cycle or Stimulated Cycle Versus Hormone Replaced Cycle in Patients Undergoing Frozen-thawed Embryo Transfer

lead_sponsor.agency: Women's Hospital School Of Medicine Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Women's Hospital School Of Medicine Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Recent sutdies indicate that the existence of corpus lutein in the ovary is a key point to prevent preeclampsia, and patients undergoing FET with hormone replaced cycle have no corpus lutein and the absence of corpus lutein significantly increases the risk of preeclampsia in these patients. We aim to conduct a single center randomized trial study to compare the preeclampsia rate between the natural cycle and the hormone replaced cycle in patients undergoing FET.

primary_outcome.description: A delivery is considered successful live birth

secondary_outcome.description: Preeclampsia is defined using the current American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists definitions (Gynecologists; and Pregnancy 2013)

arm_group.description: patients will have ovulation before embryo transfer

arm_group.arm_group_label: hormone replaced cycle for endometrium preparation
arm_group.description: patients will do not have ovulation before embryo transfer

intervention.description: patients will not use oral contraceptive drugs

intervention.intervention_name: hormone replaced cycle for endometrium preparation
intervention.description: patients will receive oral contraceptive drugs for menstruation before embryo transfer
intervention.arm_group_label: hormone replaced cycle for endometrium preparation

overall_official.affiliation: Women's Hospital School Of Medicine Zhejiang University
